intro: Agrostis rupestris f. alpinoides, commonly known as the alpine bentgrass, is a variant of the bentgrass species native to mountainous regions. It is a low-growing, mat-forming perennial grass that thrives in rocky and alpine environments. The plant features narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, spikelet-based flowers. It is adapted to cold climates and poor soil conditions, making it a hardy species. Its ecological role includes stabilizing soil and providing habitat for alpine flora and fauna.
